intro: Chondrilla debilis, commonly known as the slender goatweed, is a small flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to drought conditions through its deep root system and succulent leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Chondrilla debilis is often found in disturbed areas and can serve as a pioneer species in ecological succession.
